intro: Acourtia montana, commonly known as the mountain acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions, preferring full sun exposure. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range from white to pinkish in color. Acourtia montana is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh alpine conditions.
